RelativeTemporalAnnotation.TEXT: ADMISSION DATE : 05/29/2000 DISCHARGE DATE : 05/30/2000 HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 51 year-old female , with a non-toxic multinodular goiter . She has developed symptoms from a right lower dominant nodule with pressure discomfort in the neck . She has no dyspnea or dysphagia . She is euthyroid . There is no family history of thyroid cancer . She has not received prior radiation exposure . HOSPITAL COURSE : On 5-29-00 , she underwent thyroidectomy with removal of a 3.3 centimeter right lobe microfollicular adenoma and left lobe 6 mm . papillary carcinoma . There was no evidence of any middle compartment lymphadenopathy or spread of the tumor outside the thyroid . She had an uncomplicated postoperative recovery period . Her sutures were removed on postoperative day # one , at which time she went home in satisfactory condition .
